sorular.soru: Your car and trailer together are 8 metres long. In which situation are you allowed to keep driving like this?

feedback.metin: In the upper right and bottom right situations, you drive in the right position. In the upper left situation, you drive in the leftmost lane of the three. If your combination car including trailer is longer than 7 metres, you may only use the two rightmost lanes. In the situation below left, you do not keep enough to the right. You have to use the rush-hour lane here.

sorular.soru: In which situation should you let the oncoming car go first?

feedback.metin: In the upper left, upper right and bottom left situations you have to let the oncoming car go first. As soon as a traffic light is a round bulb and you want to turn left, oncoming traffic can have green at the same time as you, and the rule ‘through traffic on the same road goes before traffic turning off’ still applies (upper right situation). If traffic lights are out of order, this rule also applies (both left situations). Only when you approach a traffic light with a green arrow, you can be sure you don't have to let oncoming traffic go first (bottom right situation).

sorular.soru: Which sign indicates a one-way street?

feedback.metin: Sign C-4 indicates a one-way street. The sign is often placed opposite a side road of a T-junction, when there is one-way traffic on the main road. The sign D-4 means: command to follow the direction of travel and the sign C-1 indicates a declaration of closure.
